text: Cruel Intentions (TV Series) Cruel Intentions is an American drama and romance TV series. It is based on the 1999 movie of the same name, which itself was inspired by the French novel Les Liaisons Dangereuses by Pierre Choderlos de Laclos. Plot The story follows two step-siblings, Caroline Merteuil and Lucien Belmont, who are rich, powerful, and ruthless. They attend the prestigious Manchester College near Washington, D.C. The siblings will do anything to stay at the top of the social ladder, including manipulation and betrayal. When a scandal threatens to expose the corrupt system of the school's elite societies, they create a dangerous plan. They involve Annie Grover, the daughter of the Vice President of the United States, in their schemes. The show explores themes like power, love, loyalty, and morality. Main Cast Sarah Catherine Hook as Caroline Merteuil Zac Burgess as Lucien Belmont Savannah Smith as Annie Grover Production The series was created by Phoebe Fisher and Sara Goodman. It is produced by Sony Pictures Television and Amazon MGM Studios. The show streams on Amazon Freevee. Reception The show has received mixed reviews. Some praised its bold storytelling and modern themes, while others criticized it for not living up to the original movie. It has a rating of 3.2/5 based on six user reviews.
